Episodes.Title: Pilot
Episodes.Plot:
Today is the first day of the rest of Earl Hickey's life. After coming into a $100,000 scratch-off lottery ticket and losing it just as fast upon being hit by a car, Earl has an epiphany in the hospital--to make up for all the terrible things he's done in the past. With his brother Randy and a motel maid named Catalina, Earl writes up a list of every misdeed he was a part of. Earl sets out to do just that, starting with #64--Kenny James, a boy he picked on in elementary school.

Episodes.GuestStars: Dale Dickey,  Carson Daly,  Frank Collison,  Trace Adkins,  Michael Avery,  Gregg Binkley,  Willam Belli,  Deborah Cresswell,  Leo Fitzpatrick

Episodes.Title: Quit Smoking
Episodes.Plot:
Earl must make amends to Donny, an intimidating thug who spent two years in jail for a robbery Earl committed. Oddly enough, the only way he can do this is by helping Donny's mom quit smoking.

Meanwhile, Joy discovers she's the beneficiary of Earl's will and decides to kill him!
Episodes.GuestStars: Kathryn Joosten,  Andrew Wasser,  Scott Lincoln,  Joshua Levine,  Roy Lee Jones,  Jack Axelrod,  Tracy  Ashton,  Silas Weir Mitchell

Episodes.Title: Randy's Touchdown
Episodes.Plot:
Back in their high school days, Earl ruined Randy's chance to score a touchdown during a key football game; now Earl must figure out a way to make things right.

Recap:

The third episode of My Name Is Earl takes a different approach then the last two. Earl adds a new quest to his list and that is getting Randy a touchdown in High school football. The story behind it is that Earl bet money that Randy's team would lose while he was playing football. Randy helped out by playing horribly, but the l
Episodes.GuestStars: Jake   Galasso,  Bob Rumnock,  Dennis Burkley,  Gregg Binkley,  Cheryl Hawker

Episodes.Title: Faked My Own Death
Episodes.Plot: When Earl meets a tough biker chick at a Halloween party, it looks like a match made in heaven--but when the costumes come off, the mismatch becomes apparent and Earl takes drastic measures to get out of the relationship.  Now, years later, Earl must find a way to make amends for deceiving the girl.
Episodes.GuestStars: Montel Williams,  Darcie Shean,  Dax Shepard,  Beth Riesgraf,  Frances Callier

Episodes.Title: Teacher Earl
Episodes.Plot:
Earl decides to teach English as a Second language to cross "Made fun of people with accents" off his karma list. While Ralph an old friend is released from prison, Earl tries to convince him in the ways of karma however Ralph ends up kidnapping Randy trying to get his hands on Earl?s lotto winnings.

Earl loved to make fun of people with funny accents and because of Karma, he wants to pay back all the people he made fun of. Scandinavian, Hispanic or Asian, he laughed at them all. What
Episodes.GuestStars: David Aranovich,  Sunkrish Bala,  Giovanni Ribisi,  Pramod  Kumar,  Phoenix  Smith,  Wahn  Lee,  Abdoulaye N'Gom,  Patty Maloney,  Tanner Maguire

Episodes.Title: Broke Joy's Fancy Figurine
Episodes.Plot:
In order to replace a fancy figurine that he broke, Earl lends a hand to help Joy's former adversary and her daughter win a mother/daughter beauty pageant . However, Joy enters the pageant also with her "dead" mother trying to win that same figurine, hoping to trade it for a hot tub.

Recap:

The episode begins with Randy sitting down at the bar. Earl walks in and hands a cereal box to Randy. He looks very happy. Earl tells Randy no more generic cereal for him. He only gets the best now.

Episodes.GuestStars: Timothy Stack,  Missi Pyle,  Chloe Moretz,  Gigi Goff,  Ellen Albertini Dow

Episodes.Title: Stole Beer From a Golfer
Episodes.Plot: Earl attempts to help Scott (guest star Johnny Galecki) get over his preoccupation with golf--an obsession caused when he and Randy started fixing Scott?s golf game to get free beer. But after becoming so thoroughly entangled in Scott?s personal life that he drives Randy away, Earl realizes that he may be the one with the obsession.
Episodes.GuestStars: Raymond Ma,  Kristina Hayes,  David Reivers,  Johnny Galecki,  Art Frankel,  Jill  Benjamin

Episodes.Title: Joy's Wedding
Episodes.Plot: Darnell and Joy decided to tie the knot while Earl learns thru Randy?s invitation that he is not invited.  To make things worse Joy has scheduled the wedding on Earl?s birthday so that all of their friends will be unable to celebrate with him. A drunken Earl crashes the party accidentally breaking Joy?s nose and now is forced to add ?ruined Joy?s wedding? to his list.
Episodes.GuestStars: Lindsay Taylor,  Trey  Carlisle,  Bill  Suplee,  Dale Dickey,  Rakefet  Abergel,  Toya Brown,  Pam Trotter,  Sam Rubin,  Johnny  Hoops

Episodes.Title: Cost Dad the Election
Episodes.Plot:
Earl tries to cross of number four off his list ?Blew dad?s chance to be elected mayor?. Four years earlier, Carl Hickey ran for mayor to redirect a proposed airplane traffic route over his house and away from the wealthy part of town. Earl unfortunately ruins any chances of his father winning when caught in on tape assaulting a police officer.  Earl must now help his father get elected and mend his relationship with his father.

Episodes.GuestStars: Phoenix  Smith,  Anthony DeMarco,  Jack Axelrod,  George  Frangides,  Vernard

Episodes.Title: White Lie Christmas
Episodes.Plot: As the holiday season comes under way a few secrets are exposed when Earl attempts to cross number seventy-four off of his list: "always ruined Joy's Christmas." Earl, Randy, and Catalina enter a radio contest to win a brand new car for Joy to make up for all of the thoughtless Christmas presents Earl gave her while they were married. While Randy and Catalina vie over the car, Earl finds out that Joy's parents believe that he's still their son-in-law and that he's just returned from the war in I
Episodes.GuestStars: Charles Noland,  Gil Christner,  Trey  Carlisle,  Saginaw Grant,  Brett Butler,  Blake Clark,  Harland Williams

Episodes.Title: Barn Burner
Episodes.Plot:
When trying to enroll her children into the Right Choice Ranch for troubled youth, Joy is denied enrollment because of a barn burning incident at the hands of a younger Earl. Earl, Randy and Catalina travel to the camp to make amends for the barn burning by building a pen for the camp?s ostrich.  Earl learns the real reason behind the barn burning incident and decides that every incident on his list after the fire should be shared by Randy.

Episodes.GuestStars: Ryan Armstrong,  Cesar Flores,  Abdoulaye N'Gom,  Josh Philipps,  Jeremy Slate,  Trey Carlisle,  Geoffrey Gould,  Christopher Grey,  Noah Crawford

Episodes.Title: O Karma, Where Art Thou?
Episodes.Plot:
When Earl and Randy try to return a stolen wallet they find out taking the money had cost two newlyweds their honeymoon. In an attempt to make things right Earl takes over for the groom at his fast food restaurant. After time Earl finds out the boss is a jerk and Earl wonders how such a man with a luxurious house and beautiful wife could not be affected by the only thing he believes in, Karma.

Episodes.Title: Stole P's HD Cart
Episodes.Plot:
Earl crosses another number off the list when he returns Pops? Weiner Hot Dog cart he and Ralph (Giovanni Ribisi) stole in his youth. The good deed does not last long as Ralph, who works for a competing franchise sets fire to Pops cart. Earl now must set things right with a bizarre plan while recruiting Randy, Joy, Catalina and Darnell to assist him.

Episodes.GuestStars: Giovanni Ribisi,  Joe Howard,  Trey Carlisle,  Ramon Chavez,  Mary K. Devault,  Gregg Binkley,  Mark Christopher Lawrence,  Terence Bernie Hines,  Patricia Belcher,  Lou Wagner

Episodes.Title: Monkeys in Space
Episodes.Plot: Earl tackles number eighteen on his list when one of his old friends is arrested. Remebering that he told an inappropriate story at his birthday party he must give him one great day to make up the the terrible one before he was sent to prison.
Episodes.GuestStars: Daniele O'Loughlin,  Michael Hagiwara,  E.J. Callahan,  George Sharperson,  Dona Hardy,  Booth Colman,  Tracy Ashton,  Tim DeKay

Episodes.Title: Something to Live For
Episodes.Plot: Earl takes his car troubles as a sign that it is time for him to redeem himself for a long run of stealing gas out of a complete stranger's car.
Episodes.GuestStars: Peter Spruyt,  Adam Goldberg

Episodes.Title: The Professor
Episodes.Plot: Earl's nervous about returning a laptop computer he stole from a college professor, mostly because he's uncomfortable around smart people. When the professor turns out to be a beautiful woman, he feels even more ill at ease, until she flatters him and asks him to speak about his list in front of her class. Meanwhile, Randy experiences fraternity life---and absolutely loves it.
Episodes.GuestStars: Christine Taylor,  Jacob Newman,  Alan Conn,  George Frangides,  Kasan Butcher,  Noah Crawford

Episodes.Title: Didn't Pay Taxes
Episodes.Plot: Earl attempts to cross off another deed of his list. This time trying to repay the government after failing to pay his taxes in the past.
Episodes.GuestStars: Seth Sultan,  Patrick T. Gorman,  Michael Bailey Smith,  Yvette Cruise,  Countrified Wedman,  George Frangides,  Bill Suplee,  Tim DeKay,  Thomas Crawford

Episodes.Title: Dad's Car
Episodes.Plot: It's Mother's Day again when Earl  remembers that he has never given his mother a Mother's Day gift Just as he and Randy are about to finish carrying out his long overdue gift his mother decides her repayment should include Earl doing something for his father.
Episodes.GuestStars: Nancy Lenehan,  Beau Bridges,  Ben Falcone,  Timothy Olyphant

Episodes.Title: Y2K
Episodes.Plot: When Earl is attempting to cross number 24 ("Stole a red 'Take-a-number' machine? ) off his list, Randy tries to get Earl to back down by trying to make him remember, through a flashback, how they got the machine around New Year?s Eve 1999. Darnell convinces the gang to believe that Y2K will signal the end of the world and they, happily, will be the last people on Earth.
Episodes.GuestStars: William Charlton,  Tatum McCann,  Doug Wax,  Silas Weir Mitchell,  Alejandro Patino,  Pattie Tierce,  Timothy Stack,  Rob Elk,  Charles Howerton

Episodes.Title: Boogeyman
Episodes.Plot: Earl decides to cross off "made a kid scared of the boogeyman" from his list. Earl soon discovers just what kind of lasting affect he had on the little boy.
Episodes.GuestStars: Andrea DeOliveira,  Khamani Griffin,  Tucker Smallwood,  Leonard Earl Howze,  Malcolm David Kelley,  Anne Johnson,  Warren  Watkins,  Cece Tsou

Episodes.Title: The Bounty Hunter
Episodes.Plot: Number forty-five "Ditched Jessie to Marry Joy" is next on the list when Jessie, Earl's ex-girlfriend returns to town seeking revenge. Earl must protect Joy in a lakeside retreat while Randy fights not to reveal their location to Jessie.
Episodes.GuestStars: Juliette Lewis,  Tiffany  Haddish,  Joon Lee,  Jackson Bond,  Dana Cuomo,  Don Swayze

Episodes.Title: Stole a Badge
Episodes.Plot: Earl tackles No. 127 on his list by making amends for pilfering a police officer's badge. When he discovers that the theft resulted in the cop's demotion, he tries to get the officer reinstated.
Episodes.GuestStars: Max Perlich,  Alan Conn,  Mike O'Malley,  Clint Howard,  William Stanford Davis,  Steve Seagren,  Laura Johnson,  Kerry O'Malley,  Joe Kay,  Joan M. Blair,  Helen Siff,  Abdoulaye N'Gom

Episodes.Title: BB
Episodes.Plot: Earl attempts to cross out number 147 on his list "Shot Gwen Waters with a BB Gun."  To make things right he must reunite Gwen with her estranged father which Earl finds increasingly difficult.
Episodes.GuestStars: Jen Relyea,  Noah Crawford,  Jack Betts,  John DiMaggio,  Geoffrey Lewis,  Dale Dickey,  Miriam Shor,  Sam Scarber,  Tom Carey,  David Raibon,  Shailene Woodley,  Grace Bustos

Episodes.Title: Number One
Episodes.Plot: In the season finale, Earl decides to cross off the first number on his karma list, ?Stole ten dollars from a guy at the Camden Market.? Earl to his dismay finds out that he owes much more than ten dollars, in fact he must surrender all his lotto winnings. Earl now ponders when karma is going to help him with his misfortunes.
Episodes.GuestStars: Stanley Yale,  Kevin Dorian,  Rachel Pham,  Andrew Vo,  Mio,  Tracy Ashton,  Cameron  Clapp,  Bill Suplee,  Yetta Ginsburg,  Dennis Burkley,  Abdul Goznobi,  Dale Dickey,  Max Perlich,  Lin Shaye
